job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Lima, OH
pros: You have a lot of good chronic patients that care about you and the hours are decent. We don’t work any of the bigger holidays and have every Sunday off.
cons: The manager is very unprofessional and lacks communication skills. She loves the drama and brings a lot of toxicity to the team but blames her team for it. She lies to staff and is not trustworthy. She accommodates for certain employees but not others because she plays a lot of favoritism. She talks behind staffs backs and does not show appreciation to her staff. She does not follow policies and speaks out of both sides of her mouth. There is a high turn around rate in this department for a lot of these reasons mentioned.

job_title: PRN Outreach Phlebotomist in Lima, OH
pros: Great pay for PRN positions. Most of the staff are willing to help other out and generally are very focused on providing the best customer/patient care possible. If you can get passed the hours, it's not a horrible job.
cons: Outreach phlebotomists are on call 48 hrs. straight on the weekends. One phlebotomist worked 23 hrs one day went home and slept for 5 hrs and then got called back in for an additional 10 hrs. Then got in trouble because the lead lab tech told her to take the company car home since she was still on call.

review_title: "Quality Care in a Family Atmosphere"  Is a joke - I would never treat "family" in the manner Senior Mgmt does
pros: The hospital once was a great place to work - the past six - seven years have been in a steady decline.
cons: The huge disconnect between Administration, Management and the workers carrying out the daily tasks/functions that actually keep the patients safe and well cared for.  Administration needs completely revamped - as in ProMedica needs to clean house and get rid of the dead weight.

pros: Work with great people
cons: It is very hard to advance into new positions in this company, When I came into the company I came in a bachelors degree and applied for a large amount of positions. I later learned from the employees that have been working in this area of the hospital is that there are not many people that are able to leave dietary and go to other positions.

review_title: Turned out to be the worse place I ever worked.
pros: Enjoyed working with my fellow nurses. Always have job openings.
cons: Too much on call, clueless management that have no idea about patient acuity and adequate RN to patient ratio, they are more concerned with saving money than saving patients. A very weak union that really does nothing except take union dues. Revolving door for employees.
